ingredients: Flour (amount for desired number of gorditas)
Baking powder (amount based on flour quantity)
Vegetable shortening (amount based on flour quantity)
Filling ingredients of your choice (e.g., cooked meat, beans, cheese, vegetables)
instructions: Mix flour, baking powder, and salt.
Mix in vegetable shortening until dough is well-textured.
Gradually add water and knead until dough is moldable and doesn't stick to hands.
Form dough into balls slightly larger than biscuit size.
Let dough balls rest for 10 minutes.
Press each dough ball into a thick, flat disk (like a small pie plate).
Cook on a griddle or moderately warm stove top until cooked through but not browned.
Make a small slit in the side of each gordita.
Fill with desired ingredients and serve warm.
cooking_tips: Adjust baking powder and shortening according to the type of flour used.
Don't overwork the dough, as this can make the gorditas tough.
Cook gorditas over medium heat to ensure they cook evenly without burning.
Get creative with fillings! Traditional options include seasoned meats, refried beans, cheese, and various salsas.
